title: Purisima, Napeñas barred from leaving Philippines
text:
Headlines   1 Purisima, Napeñas barred from leaving Philippines By Patricia Lourdes Viray (philstar.com)   9:22am Former Philippine National Police chief Alan Purisima and former Special Action Force Director Getulio Napeñas are accused of of usurpation of public functions and graft. Senate PRIB, File 
MANILA, Philippines — Anti-graft court Sandiganbayan issued a hold departure order against dismissed Philippine National Police (PNP) chief Alan Purisima and former Special Action Force (SAF) director Getulio Napeñas in connection to the Mamasapano case. 
Purisima and Napeñas are facing charges of usurpation of public functions and graft. 
The Fourth Division of the Sandiganbayan directed the Bureau of Immigration to prohibit the two accused from leaving the country for any destination abroad. 
The two police officers involved in the Mamasapano clash may only leave the country if they have written permission secured and granted by the court. 
Preliminary investigation of the Office of the Ombudsman showed that Purisima and Napeñas coordinated a top level meeting with military officers for the Mamasapano operation, dubbed as Oplan Exodus. 
Purisima was then under preventive suspension stemming from his graft case over an anomalous courier deal of the PNP. Headlines   
The former PNP chief ordered the SAF to conceptualize the operation to arrest Malaysian terrorist Zulkifli bin Hir, alias Marwan, in Mamasapano, Maguindanao on Jan . 25, 2015. He also ordered Napeñas to brief then President Benigno Aquino III about the operation. 
Members of the Moro Islamic Liberation Front and Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters attacked the SAF commandos after killing Marwan. 
This encounter led to the death of 64 Filipinos, including 44 SAF troopers. Headlines
